<!-- Generated by documentation.js. Update this documentation by updating the source code. -->

## eslint-config-base

The ESLint config object for base, and imports.

### Examples

```javascript
module.exports = {
  root: true,
  extends: [
    "@alexseitsinger/eslint-config-base",
  ],
}
```

Returns **[Object][1]** The ESLint config object to extend from.

## core/best-practices

### rules

#### accessor-pairs

Enforce getter and setter pairs in objects.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/accessor-pairs][2]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 setWithoutGet: true,
 getWithoutSet: true,
}]
```

#### array-callback-return

Enforce return statements in callbacks of array methods.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/array-callback-return][3]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allowImplicit: true,
}]
```

#### block-scoped-var

Enforce the use of variables within the scope they are defined.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var][4]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### class-methods-use-this

Enforce that class methods utilize this.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/class-methods-use-this][5]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 exceptMethods: [],
}]
```

#### complexity

Enforce a maximum cyclomatic complexity allowed in a program.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/complexity][6]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 max: 30,
}]
```

#### consistent-return

Require return statements to either always or never specify values.

NOTES:

-   Since reducer functions only return for matching cases, we dont supply
    a return value at the end of them. As a result, turn this rule off to
    avoid throwng this error.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/consistent-return][7]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 treatUndefinedAsUnspecified: false,
}]
```

#### curly

Enforce consistent brace style for all control statements.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/curly][8]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "all"]
```

#### default-case

Require default cases in switch statements.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/default-case][9]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 commentPattern: "^no\\sdefault$",
}]
```

#### dot-location

Enforce consistent newlines before and after dots.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/dot-location][10]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "property"]
```

#### dot-notation

Enforce dot notation whenever possible.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/dot-notation][11]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allowKeywords: true,
 allowPattern: "",
}]
```

#### eqeqeq

Require the use of === and !==.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/eqeqeq][12]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "always"]
```

#### guard-for-in

Require for-in loops to include an if statement.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/guard-for-in][13]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### max-classes-per-file

Enforce a maximum number of classes per file.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/max-classes-per-file][14]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", 1]
```

Disallow the use of alert, confirm, and prompt.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-alert][15]

##### Examples

```javascript

```

#### no-else-return

Disallow else blocks after return statements in if statements.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-else-return][19]

##### Examples

```javascript

}]
```

#### no-empty-function

Disallow empty functions.

NOTES:

-   We sometimes use empty functions for defaultProps in react. As a
    result, allow functions and methods to be empty.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-empty-function][20]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allow: {
   "functions",
   "arrowFunctions",
   "methods",
 },
}]
```

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-empty-pattern][21]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

##### Examples

```javascript

```

#### no-invalid-this

Disallow this keywords outside of classes or class-like objects.

NOTES:

-   We use 'this' for references the global scope when we use IIFE's, etc.
    As a result, disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-invalid-this][33]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### no-magic-numbers

Disallow magic numbers.

NOTES:

-   Setting a literal 0 will throw an error with this enabled. So, disable
    this rule completely.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-magic-numbers][38]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 ignore: [],
 ignoreArrayIndexes: true,
 enforceConst: true,
 detectObjects: true,
}]
```

```javascript
 },
```

```javascript
 props: true,

   "res",
   "response",
   "staticContext",
 ],
}]
```

#### no-restricted-properties

Disallow certain properties on certain objects.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-restricted-properties][49]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
  object: "arguments",
  property: "callee",
  message: "arguemnts.callee is deprecated",
}, {
  object: "global",
  property: "isFinite",
  message: "Use Number.isFinite instead",
}, {
  object: 'self',
  property: 'isFinite',
  message: 'Please use Number.isFinite instead',
}, {
  object: 'window',
  property: 'isFinite',
  message: 'Please use Number.isFinite instead',
}, {
  object: 'global',
  property: 'isNaN',
  message: 'Please use Number.isNaN instead',
}, {
  object: 'self',
  property: 'isNaN',
  message: 'Please use Number.isNaN instead',
}, {
  object: 'window',
  property: 'isNaN',
  message: 'Please use Number.isNaN instead',
}, {
  property: '__defineGetter__',
  message: 'Please use Object.defineProperty instead.',
}, {
  property: '__defineSetter__',
  message: 'Please use Object.defineProperty instead.',
}, {
  object: 'Math',
  property: 'pow',
  message: 'Use the exponentiation operator (**) instead.',
}],
```

#### no-useless-call

Disallow unnecessary calls to .call() and .apply().

NOTES:

-   Sometimes, .call() and .apply() are used to invoke a function with a
    specific context/arguments. As a result, disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-useless-call][60]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### no-warning-comments

Disallow specified warning terms in comments.

NOTES:

-   We use warning comments to keep our place when we're developing
    something. So, disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-warning-comments][66]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 terms: ["todo", "fix"],
 location: "start",
}]
```

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-with][67]

##### Examples


Enforce using named capture group in regular expression.

NOTES:

-   This is only available in newer ecmascript version.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/prefer-named-capture-group][68]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### prefer-promise-reject-errors

Require using Error objects as Promise rejection reasons.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/prefer-promise-reject-errors][69]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

Enforce the consistent use of the radix argument when using parseInt().

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/radix][70]

##### Examples


#### require-await

Disallow async functions which have no await expression.

NOTES:

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/require-await][71]

##### Examples


Enforce the use of u flag on RegExp.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/require-unicode-regexp][72]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### vars-on-top

Require var declarations be placed at the top of their containing scope.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/vars-on-top][73]

##### Examples

```javascript

```

#### wrap-iife

Require parentheses around immediate function invocations.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/wrap-iife][74]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "outside", {
 functionPrototypeMethods: false,
}]
```

#### yoda

Require or disallow “Yoda” conditions.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/yoda][75]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "never", {
 exceptRange: true,
 onlyEquality: false,
}]
```

#### no-extra-parens

Disallow unnecessary parentheses.

(fixable)

NOTES:

-   Since we often group expressions using parens, to make them easier to
    read, we should disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-extra-parens][93]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", "all", {
 conditionalAssign: true,
 returnAssign: false,
 nestedBinaryExpressions: false,
 ignoreJSX: "all",
 enforceForArrowConditionals: false,
}]
```

```javascript
 before: true,

}]
```

#### constructor-super

Require super() calls in constructors.

## core/nodejs-commonjs

### rules

#### callback-return

Require return statements after callbacks.

NOTES:

-   Since our callback are often asyncronous, we shouldn't expect return
    statements. As a result, disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/callback-return][143]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", [
 "callback",
 "cb",
 "errback",
 "eb",
 "next",
 "fn",
 "func",
 "f",
]]
```

Require require() calls to be placed at top-level module scope.

-   Since we use require() calls in our reducer, when its hot reloaded, we
    need to disable this rule.

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### comma-dangle

Require or disallow trailing commas.

(fixable)

NOTES:

-   With function calls, we must pass a composed component tree as an
    argument. When we do this, we dont wnat to have to also pass a comma
    after the closing tag. So, ignore this rule for functions.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/comma-dangle][162]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 arrays: "always-multiline",
 objects: "always-multiline",
 imports: "always-multiline",
 exports: "always-multiline",
 functions: "ignore",
}]
```

#### no-restricted-syntax

Disallow specified syntax.

NOTES:

-   Extended this setting using the AirBNB eslint.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-restricted-syntax][211]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 selector: "FunctionExpression",
 message: "Function expressions are not allowed. Use a function declaration or an arrow function instead."
}, {
 selector: "CallExpression[callee.name='setTimeout'][arguments.length!=2]"
 message: "setTimeout must always be invoked with two arguments.",
}, {
 selector: "WithStatement",
 message: "With statements are not allowed.",
}, {
 selector: "ForInStatement",
 message: "For-In loops iterate over the entire prototype chain. Use Object.{keys,values,entries} instead."
}, {
 selector: "ForOfStatement",
 message: "iterators/generators require regenerator-runtime, which is too heavyweight. Seperately, loops should be avoided in favor of array iterations."
}, {
 selector: "LabeledStatement",
 message: "Labels are a form of GOTO; using them makes code confusing and hard to maintain and understand.
}]
```

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### no-trailing-spaces

Disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-trailing-spaces][214]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 skipBlankLines: false,
 ignoreComments: false,
}]
```

#### no-underscore-dangle

Disallow dangling underscores in identifiers.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-underscore-dangle][215]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allow: [],
 allowAfterThis: false,
 allowAfterSuper: false,
 enfoceInMethodNames: true,
}]
```

#### no-unneeded-ternary

Disallow ternary operators when simpler alternatives exist.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-unneeded-ternary][216]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 defaultAssignment: false,
}]
```

#### no-whitespace-before-property

Disallow whitespace before properties.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-whitespace-before-property][217]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### nonblock-statement-body-position

Enforce the location of single-line statements.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/nonblock-statement-body-position][218]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "below", {
 overrides: {},
}]
```

#### object-curly-newline

Enforce consistent line breaks inside braces.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/object-curly-newline][219]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 ObjectExpression: {
   multiline: true,
   consistent: true,
 },
 ObjectPattern: {
   multiline: true,
   consistent: true,
 },
 ImportDeclaration: {
   multiline: true,
   consistent: true,
 },
 ExportDeclaration: {
   multiline: true,
   consistent: true,
 },
}]
```

#### object-curly-spacing

Enforce consistent spacing inside braces.

(fixable)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/object-curly-spacing][220]

##### Examples

```javascript
 arraysInObjects: true,
 objectsInObjects: true,
}]
```

```javascript
 allowAllPropertiesOnSameLine: true,
```

## core/variables

### rules

#### init-declarations

Require or disallow initialization in variable declarations.

NOTES:

-   We sometimes declare varialbes with values, so disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/init-declarations][246]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", "never", {
 ignoreForLoopInit: true,
}]
```

#### no-delete-var

Disallow deleting variables.

NOTES:

-   We infrequently use delete on variables to enforce garbage collection.
    So, disable this rule.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-delete-var][247]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### no-label-var

Disallow labels that share a name with a variable.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-label-var][248]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### no-restricted-globals

Disallow specified global variables.

NOTES:

-   We added variables based on AirBNB's eslint config.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-restricted-globals][249]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", "isFinite", "isNan"].concat(confusingBrowserGlobals)
```

#### no-shadow

Disallow variable declarations from shadowing variables declared in the
outer scope.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-shadow][250]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 builtinGlobals: true,
 hoist: "functions",
 allow: [
   "data",
   "error",
   "resolve",
   "reject",
   "callback",
   "errback",
 ],
}]
```

#### no-shadow-restricted-names

Disallow identifiers from shadowing restricted names.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-shadow-restricted-names][251]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### no-undef

Disallow the use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in global comments.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-undef][252]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 typeof: true,
}]
```

#### no-undef-init

Disallow initializing variables to undefined.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-undef-init][253]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### no-undefined

Disallow the use of undefined as an identifier.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-undefined][254]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### no-unused-vars

Disallow unused variables.

NOTES:

-   We sometimes declare catch without using the error object, so dont
    check them.
-   Ignore rest siblings should be true,
-   We should check all variable, even global ones.

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-unused-vars][255]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 vars: "all",
 args: "after-used",
 ignoreRestSiblings: true,
 caughtErrors: "none",
}]
```

#### no-use-before-define

Disallow the use of variables before they are defined.

NOTES:

-   Since function definitions get hoisted to the top of the scope, we can
    disable this rule for functions. (This assumes we have prefered
    function definitions in another rule.)

[https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-use-before-define][256]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 functions: false,
 classes: true,
 variables: true,
}]
```

## import/helpful-warnings

### rules

#### import/export

Report any invalid exports, i.e. re-export of the same name.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/export.md][257]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-named-as-default

Report use of exported name as identifier of default export.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-named-as-default.md][258]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-named-as-default-member

Report use of exported name as property of default export.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-named-as-default-member.md][259]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-deprecated

Report imported names marked with @deprecated documentation tag.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-deprecated.md][260]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-extraneous-dependencies

Forbid the use of extraneous packages.

NOTES:

-   Since we use devDependencies in tests & webpack, we use the glob
    patterns to exclude checking modules in those files.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-extraneous-dependencies.md][261]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 devDependencies: [
   "tests/**",
   "__tests__/**",
   "jest.*.js",
   "jest/*.js,
   "webpack-config.*.js,
   "webpack.config.*.js,
 ],
 optionalDependencies: false,
 peerDependencies: false,
}]
```

#### import/no-mutable-exports

Forbid the use of mutable exports with var or let.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-mutable-exports.md][262]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-unused-modules

Report modules without exports, or exports without matching import in
another module.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-unused-modules.md][263]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 unusedExports: true,
 missingExports: true,
}]
```

## import/module-systems

### rules

#### import/unambiguous

Report potentially ambiguous parse goal (script vs. module).

NOTES:

-   This gets thrown from our webpack configs, so disable it.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/unambiguous.md][264]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-commonjs

Report CommonJS require calls and module.exports or exports.\*.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-commonjs.md][265]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 allowRequire: true,
 allowPrimitiveModules: true,
}]
```

#### import/no-amd

Report AMD require and define calls.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-amd.md][266]

\#example
"error"

#### import/no-nodejs-modules

No Node.js builtin modules.

NOTES:

-   We might need to disable this rule completely, if we find that we
    continue to use a larger number of builtin modules.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-nodejs-modules.md][267]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allow: ["fs", "path", "child_process"],
}]
```

## import/static-analysis

### rules

#### import/no-unresolved

Ensure imports point to a file/module that can be resolved.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-unresolved.md][268]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 commonjs: true,
 amd: false,
 caseSensitive: true,
}]
```

#### import/named

Ensure named imports correspond to a named export in the remote file.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/named.md][269]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/default

Ensure a default export is present, given a default import.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/default.md][270]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/namespace

Ensure imported namespaces contain dereferenced properties as they are dereferenced.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/namespace.md][271]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 allowComputed: false,
}]
```

#### import/no-restricted-paths

Restrict which files can be imported in a given folder.

NOTES:

-   Since we split the frontend bundles into two (client, server) we could
    add zones to prevent importing server bundles from client.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-restricted-paths.md][272]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 zones: [],
}]
```

#### import/no-absolute-path

Forbid import of modules using absolute paths.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-absolute-path.md][273]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 esmodule: true,
 commonjs: true,
 amd: true,
}]
```

#### import/no-dynamic-require

Forbid require() calls with expressions.

NOTES:

-   We use dynamic requires for packages, so disable this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-dynamic-require.md][274]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-internal-modules

Prevent importing the submodules of other modules.

NOTES:

-   We often import components from subdirectories, we disable this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-internal-modules.md][275]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 allow: [],
}]
```

#### import/no-webpack-loader-syntax

Forbid webpack loader syntax in imports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-webpack-loader-syntax.md][276]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-self-import

Forbid a module from importing itself.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-self-import.md][277]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-cycle

Forbid a module from importing a module with a dependency path back to
itself.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-cycle.md][278]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 maxDepth: Infinity,
}]
```

#### import/no-useless-path-segments

Prevent unnecessary path segments in import and require statements.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-useless-path-segments.md][279]

#### import/no-relative-parent-imports

Forbid importing modules from parent directories.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-relative-parent-imports.md][280]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-unused-modules

Forbid modules without any export, and exports not imported by any
modules..

NOTES:

-   We have unused exports in webpack configs, we disable this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-unused-modules.md][263]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 unusedExports: true,
 missingExports: true,
}]
```

## import/style-guide

### rules

#### import/first

Ensure all imports appear before other statements.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/first.md][281]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/exports-last

Ensure all exports appear after other statements,

NOTES:

-   With React, we sometimes export stateless functional components, then
    define its propType below, so disable this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/exports-last.md][282]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-duplicates

Report repeated import of the same module in multiple places.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-duplicates.md][283]

##### Examples

```javascript
"error"
```

#### import/no-namespace

Report namespace imports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-namespace.md][284]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/extensions

Ensure consistent use of file extension within the import path.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/extensions.md][285]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 js: "never",
 jsx: "never",
 json: "always",
 css: "always",
 ico: "always",
 svg: "always",
 png: "always",
 jpg: "always",
 gif: "always",
 ttf: "always",
 otf: "always",
}]
```

#### import/order

Enforce a convention in module import order.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/order.md][286]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 groups: [
   ["builtin", "external"],
   ["internal", "parent", "sibling", "index"],
 ],
 "nexlines-between": "always",
}]
```

#### import/newline-after-import

Enforce a newline after import statements.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/newline-after-import.md][287]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 count: 1,
}]
```

#### import/prefer-default-export

Prefer a default export if module exports a single name.

NOTES:

-   Using named exports in packages allows for more flexibility when the
    package grows and functionality is added later on. As a result, disable
    this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/prefer-default-export.md][288]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/max-dependencies

Limit the maximum number of dependencies a module can have.

NOTES:

-   Some modules use a lot of dependencies, so either increase this to a
    larger number, or disable it completely.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/max-dependencies.md][289]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 max: 40,
}]
```

#### import/no-unassigned-import

Forbid unassigned imports.

NOTES:

-   We might need to disable this rule completely, if we find that we
    continue to use a larger number of unassigned modules.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-unassigned-import.md][290]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 allow: [
   "core-js/stable",
   "url-search-params-polyfill",
 ]
}]
```

#### import/no-named-default

Forbid named default exports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-named-default.md][291]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-default-export

Forbid default exports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-default-export.md][292]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-named-export

Forbid named exports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-named-export.md][293]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/no-anonymous-default-export

Forbid anonymous values as default exports,

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/no-anonymous-default-export.md][294]

##### Examples

```javascript
["off", {
 allowArray: false,
 allowArrowFunction: false,
 allowAnonymousClass: false,
 allowAnonymousFunction: false,
 allowLiteral: false,
 allowObject: false,
}]
```

#### import/group-exports

Prefer named exports to be grouped together in a single export
declaration.

NOTES:

-   Since we sometimes export functions as we define them throughout a
    module, its probably better to disable this rule.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/group-exports.md][295]

##### Examples

```javascript
"off"
```

#### import/dynamic-import-chunkname

Enforce a leading comment with the webpackChunkName for dynamic imports.

[https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/blob/master/docs/rules/dynamic-import-chunkname.md][296]

##### Examples

```javascript
["error", {
 importFunctions: [],
 webpackChunknameFormat: "[a-zA-Z0-9-/_.]",
}]
```
